docs.snippet: 9 P.M. (Starz) REDBELT (2008) In this fight film written and directed by David Mamet, a Los Angeles jujitsu instructor (Chiwetel Ejiofor) with money troubles saves a pampered, slumming action star (Tim Allen, above right) from a beating. After whi...
docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (Starz) REDBELT (2008) In this fight film written and directed by David Mamet, a Los Angeles jujitsu instructor (Chiwetel Ejiofor) with money troubles saves a pampered, slumming action star (Tim Allen, above right) from a beating. After which promises of friendship ensue, and principles are surrendered. Writing in The New York Times, Manohla Dargis said Mr. Mamet had ''taken a sturdy B-movie conceit -- a good man versus the bad world, plus blood -- tricked it out with his rhythms, his corrosive words and misanthropy, and come up with a satisfying, unexpectedly involving B movie that owes as much to old Hollywood as to Greek tragedy.'' 6:30 P.M. (Fox) AT THE MOVIES Ben Lyons and Ben Mankiewicz offer their opinions of ''Street Fighter: The Legend of Chun-Li,'' starring Kristin Kreuk (''Smallville'') as the video game heroine, and ''Crossing Over,'' Wayne Kramer's drama with Harrison Ford, Ray Liotta and Ashley Judd, about immigrants struggling to achieve legal status in Los Angeles.

docs.snippet: T Magazine's Senior Editor Sandra Ballentine opens up her little black book of tips on where to go, what to buy and whom to know. Name: JBM Vintage File Under: Vintage Showrooms, New York, By AppointmentAddress: 11 East 75th Street, New York NY 10...
docs.lead_paragraph: T Magazine's senior editor Sandra Ballentine opens up her little black book of tips on where to go, what to buy and whom to know.
docs.abstract: T Magazine's Senior Editor Sandra Ballentine opens up her little black book of tips on where to go, what to buy and whom to know. Name: JBM Vintage File Under: Vintage Showrooms, New York, By AppointmentAddress: 11 East 75th Street, New York NY 10021Telephone Number: (212) 585-3555Web site: JBMvintage.comWhat To Get: These days, spending a lot of money so we can dress up makes us feel like we deserve a serious dressing down. Enter JBM, a high-end vintage salon for fashion plates who like their designer duds served with a side of fiscal restraint. Co-owners Jennifer Bandier and Lori Margolis have been collecting vintage fashion for decades, so the selection is vast and tantalizing. You'll find confections by Dior, Chanel, Halston, Oscar, Pucci and Gucci -- all way below what you'd pay retail. And if it's a one night stand you're looking for, you can rent a cocktail dress or gown for $150.What I Lust For: I longingly eyed a spectacular jeweled Pucci gown -- that is until the girls told me they're waiting for a museum curator to price it. Gulp. Instead, I'll opt for a chic, beige, knit Pierre Cardin dress with gold buttons ($350), a cute, round leather and metal Dior purse ($500) and a YSL pussy bow silk blouse ($400). Just when I thought it was safe to leave, on my way out the door I spied a fantastic necklace with huge orange and blue stones for $550. So much for fiscal restraint.Atmosphere: Located in a swanky Upper East Side townhouse between Park and Madison, the showroom has old-worldy touches that compliment the clothes, including pretty moldings, a fireplace and an old black glass chandelier Bandier found at a New Mexico flea market while visiting a vintage Dior vendor.

docs.snippet: FOR CHILDREN     BAMKIDS FILM FESTIVAL (Saturday and Sunday) Just when you thought the movie awards were over, here come the BAMmies. They're the prizes voted by children in this annual film festival, now in its 11th edition at the Brooklyn Academ...
docs.lead_paragraph: FOR CHILDREN BAMKIDS FILM FESTIVAL (Saturday and Sunday) Just when you thought the movie awards were over, here come the BAMmies. They're the prizes voted by children in this annual film festival, now in its 11th edition at the Brooklyn Academy of Music. The fare, for ages 2 through 13, consists of 50 short and feature films from 21 countries, many having New York premieres. Live music, face painting, moviemaking and discussions with filmmakers are also among the draws. Programs start at 10 a.m., 30 Lafayette Avenue, at Ashland Place, Fort Greene, (718) 777-3456, bam.org; $11 per screening; $5 for ages 13 and under; $8 for 65+; $7 for BAM Cinema Club members; $7 for musical performances only.

docs.snippet: From the admittedly spotty anecdotal evidence, this recession thing might be more nuanced than many first figured, at least as far as Hollywood is concerned....
docs.lead_paragraph: From the admittedly spotty anecdotal evidence, this recession thing might be more nuanced than many first figured, at least as far as Hollywood is concerned. Yesterday, the room was full and would-be diners were being parked in line at the very high-line The BLVD restaurant at the Beverly Wilshire Hotel. At The BLVD, you can get a $28 salad, if you can get your salad at all from the harried wait-staff.
docs.abstract: From the admittedly spotty anecdotal evidence, this recession thing might be more nuanced than many first figured, at least as far as Hollywood is concerned.
